results.title: Persuasion
results.brief_description: Despite knowing her own heart, Anne Elliot allows herself to be “persuaded” into rejecting the proposal of Captain Wentworth. After an eight year separation, they meet again. Although still eligible and now prosperous, Wentworth is still bitter and courts the attention of Louisa Musgrove. As is typical of all Austen novels, as Anne and Wentworth undertake the road to matrimony, a small section of a long ago society, with its social mores is exposed. Adapted by Julian Mitchell, this BBC production has the flavour of authenticity and features Ann Firbank and Bryan Marshall as the two lovers.

results.title: Persuaders
results.creator_credit: David Chesworth, Sonia Leber and Wax Sound Media
results.brief_description:
The installation is composed from ‘fragments’ of video and audio captured in real time from short bursts of activity to longer passages of action or inaction.

Each monitor contains an individual person who has been videotaped while barracking for a particular sport. Each person is presented in close-up, with the eyeline straight to camera, staring directly at the viewer. The sound of each person is also in ‘close-up’, transmitted through a number of loudspeakers in the space. With apparent proximity, we can hear great detail in the breath and voice.

results.title: Perspectrum = Perspectre
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dorothy Courtois and Ishu Patel
results.brief_description: An animated film of simple geometric forms, as thin and flat as playing cards, but so arranged that a sense of perspective is conveyed. The effect is somewhat like the patterns seen in a kaleidoscope, but much more active, forming and re-forming constantly to the music. The koto, a thirteen-stringed Japanese instrument, is played by plucking the strings; the sound has a tinkling effect, well-suited to the glasslike shapes of the moving designs. A film without words.

results.title: Perspectives on Pride and prejudice
results.brief_description: Perspectives on Pride and Prejudice explores the meaning, language, relationships and social milieu of Jane Austen’s much-loved 1813 novel, within an educational context. In 1996 the BBC produced a 6-part miniseries of “Pride and prejudice”, starring Jennifer Ehle and Colin Firth as Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy as the lovers-to-be, which was extremely well received. This multi-media kit contains an 85-minute video, 75-minute audiocassette and a booklet of suggested activities to accompany both the novel and the film text. The actors who feature in that production discuss their views on the characters they portray. Academics from various streams join in panel discussion about the characters and the layers of meaning detectable within Austen’s prose. Divided into sections, the kit offers teachers, students and lovers of Jane Austen a chance to develop their experience and responses to the text both as a novel and as a screen work.

results.title: Perspective: student nurse
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Bairstow and Donald Ginsberg
results.brief_description: A picture of nurses-in-training at a large city hospital in Montreal. The starched blue uniforms of the probationers barely conceal the nervousness with which they approach their new vocation, but apparent above all is the earnest desire to learn and to do what the profession demands. The film also shows some of the courses the nurses take before they are qualified to receive their caps.

results.title: Personality conflict
results.brief_description: A dramatized example of what happens when two conflicting personalities must work together. Designed to stimulate discussion on the adjustment that supervisors must make, Peter is rather retiring, particular and conscious of his position, His new assistant, Jim, is exuberant and almost aggressively well-meaning. Pete dislikes Jim’s suggestions on altering routines and resents his attitude even more. When he overhears Jim discussing the situation with other men in the cafeteria he is extremely angry, calls Pete into his office and has it out with him. Neither is satisfied and Pete takes the situation to the personnel manager, who tells him it is too late to make a change and that he is capable of making the adjustment. The audience is asked: how should Pete handle Jim?

results.title: Personal presentation skills
results.brief_description: This instructive video provides valuable background on how to prepare a presentation to either a large group or small gathering. Different techniques are described, demonstrated and evaluated in terms of effectiveness. Covers methods such as reading, memorising, impromptu and speaking from notes so that the viewer can gain confidence and give a successful presentation, regardless of level of experience. The underlying values of preparation, knowing your audience and recognising your own style are also outlined.

results.title: Personal hygiene for women. Part 2
results.brief_description: Describes the hygienic measures necessary to prevent the spread of contagious diseases. Shows in an experiment how a cold may be spread. Points out the prevalence of venereal disease, and explains the cause, symptoms, cure, and prevention of syphilis, gonorrhoea, and chancroid.

results.title: Personal Hygiene For Boys (second edition)
results.brief_description: Designed to increase the understanding of personal hygiene - this film shows the importance of proper rest, diet and exercise to good health and appearance. It also deals with the special problems teenage boys have regarding personal hygiene and the changes taking place in their maturing bodies.

results.title: Personal development curriculum
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Sabina Baltrukomis and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Highlights the process of practical problem solving in personal development. Shows children engaged in a process of thinking, feeling, and making decisions about themselves and others that lead to appropriate action.
